name: AI-Powered DAO & Governance
description: Comprehensive evaluation template for AI applications in DAO operations, governance, and decision-making processes
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: AI Governance Capabilities
categories.description: Evaluation of AI's role in governance and decision-making processes

metrics.name: Proposal Analysis
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven proposal analysis and impact assessment

thresholds.T0: Advanced NLP-driven proposal analysis with multi-dimensional impact assessment; simulation of proposal outcomes under various conditions; detection of conflicts with existing governance; automatic identification of governance attack vectors; historical precedent analysis; visualization of expected outcomes
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced proposal analysis; simple impact assessment; identification of obvious conflicts with existing governance; minimal simulation capabilities

metrics.name: Voting Assistance
metrics.description: Quality of AI assistance in voting decisions and delegation

thresholds.T0: Sophisticated AI voting recommendation system considering user values, historical preferences, and stake; personalized explanation of voting logic; automatic detection of vote manipulation; intelligent delegation suggestions based on alignment scores; real-time adaptation to changing governance landscape
thresholds.T1: Basic AI voting suggestions based on simple preference matching; standard explanation of voting options; basic delegation recommendations; reasonable adaptation to governance changes

metrics.name: Consensus Building
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI in facilitating consensus and resolving governance conflicts

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI-driven consensus mechanisms identifying minimal viable agreements; automated conflict resolution suggestions; identification of preference clusters among stakeholders; generation of compromise proposals; sentiment analysis during discussions; transparent facilitation of multi-stakeholder negotiations
thresholds.T1: Basic AI tools for identifying areas of agreement; simple conflict resolution suggestions; standard sentiment analysis; reasonable facilitation of discussions

categories.name: Resource Management
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in managing DAO resources and treasury operations

metrics.name: Treasury Management
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven treasury management and financial optimization

thresholds.T0: AI-powered dynamic treasury management with multi-scenario risk modeling; automated diversification strategies; real-time treasury optimization based on market conditions; on-chain and off-chain asset integration; predictive cash flow management; transparent reporting with anomaly detection
thresholds.T1: Basic AI treasury management tools; standard diversification approaches; periodic treasury optimization; conventional reporting mechanisms; reasonable risk assessment

metrics.name: Budget Allocation
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI-guided budget allocation and funding prioritization

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI budget allocation system with impact prediction models; objective ROI assessment for proposals; quadratic funding optimization; automated detection of capital inefficiencies; dynamic reallocation based on milestone achievements; multi-factor scoring of funding requests
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-assisted budget allocation; standard ROI estimation; simple prioritization mechanisms; reasonable milestone tracking; conventional scoring of funding requests

metrics.name: Resource Optimization
metrics.description: Efficiency of AI in optimizing non-financial DAO resources

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive AI resource management across talent, time, and technical infrastructure; skill-to-task matching algorithms; predictive resource scaling; automated bottleneck identification; network-wide resource sharing protocols; efficient coordination of distributed teams
thresholds.T1: Basic AI resource management tools; standard skill matching; manual resource scaling with AI assistance; conventional coordination mechanisms

categories.name: Member Engagement
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in managing member engagement and contribution systems

metrics.name: Contribution Tracking
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven contribution tracking and reward systems

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI contribution tracking across on-chain and off-chain activities; sophisticated value attribution models; sybil-resistant reputation systems; proof-of-contribution verification; granular skill and expertise tracking; multi-dimensional contribution metrics; transparent reward distribution algorithms
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced contribution tracking; standard reputation systems; reasonable value attribution; conventional reward mechanisms; simple skill tracking

metrics.name: Member Matching
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI in matching members to tasks and collaborative opportunities

thresholds.T0: Sophisticated AI matching algorithms considering skills, interests, availability, and past collaborations; predictive team formation for optimal outcomes; cross-DAO talent discovery; intelligent task decomposition; proactive identification of collaboration opportunities; continuous learning from successful matches
thresholds.T1: Basic AI matching capabilities based on self-reported skills; standard team formation tools; manual task assignment with AI assistance; reactive identification of collaboration opportunities

metrics.name: Engagement Optimization
metrics.description: Quality of AI tools for optimizing member engagement and retention

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI engagement systems with personalized interaction recommendations; churn prediction with preventative interventions; community health analytics; automated community-building initiatives; behavioral analysis for engagement optimization; multi-channel coordination; sentiment-aware communication
thresholds.T1: Basic AI engagement tools; standard churn prediction; simple community health metrics; conventional engagement initiatives; reasonable sentiment analysis

categories.name: Risk & Compliance
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in risk management and compliance for DAOs

metrics.name: Risk Detection
metrics.description: Quality of AI risk detection and assessment systems

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI risk monitoring covering operational, financial, governance, and technical domains; real-time detection of attack vectors; sophisticated simulation of adverse scenarios; multi-agent system stress testing; governance exploit prediction; smart contract vulnerability detection; early warning system for ecosystem risks
thresholds.T1: Basic AI risk detection for major categories; standard simulation of common scenarios; conventional vulnerability assessments; reasonable warning systems for obvious risks

metrics.name: Compliance Monitoring
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI compliance monitoring and regulatory adaptation

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive AI regulatory monitoring across global jurisdictions; automated compliance assessment for proposals; real-time regulatory change alerts with impact analysis; predictive compliance for emerging regulations; multi-jurisdictional legal entity optimization; compliance-aware proposal generation
thresholds.T1: Basic AI regulatory monitoring in main jurisdictions; standard compliance checks; manual regulatory change tracking with AI assistance; conventional compliance assessments

metrics.name: Fraud Prevention
metrics.description: Quality of AI-powered fraud prevention and security measures

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI fraud detection with behavior-based analytics; coordinated attack identification; sophisticated anomaly detection for transaction patterns; governance manipulation protection; multi-signature workflow optimization; real-time alerting with automated intervention options; continuous adaptation to new attack vectors
thresholds.T1: Basic AI fraud detection; standard anomaly detection; reasonable protection against common attacks; conventional multi-signature processes; manual intervention with AI alerts
